item.title: DeathSprint 66 - Official Gameplay Reveal Trailer
item.description: High-speed foot-racing game DeathSprint 66 shows off its deadly, dystopian world in a new gameplay trailer revealed at PC Gaming Show 2024

item.title: Sinh, The Slumbering Dragon Uses Dark Souls 2â€™s Worst Mechanic in the Best Way
item.description:
Highlights

  • Sinh's corrosive scales in Dark Souls 2 force players to manage weapon durability in a unique and challenging way.
  • Preparing for Sinh's encounter requires players to bring repair powders or utilize a flexible build with multiple weapons.
  • Weapon durability in Dark Souls 2, specifically against Sinh, highlights the mechanic as a critical part of combat strategy, even if it is annoying elsewhere.

Equipment durability is a divisive topic for action games like Dark Souls 2 , as the mechanic can often conflict with a cohesive gameplay feel as weapons and armor breaking at key moments rarely appears to be a planned challenge. However, in the case of Sinh, the Slumbering Dragon, the durability in Dark Souls 2 makes mastering a single weapon only part of the puzzle for defeating the boss.

Locked behind the Crown of the Sunken King DLC for Dark Souls 2 , Sinh is a unique encounter, due to the way that players will need to be prepared in order to survive the encounter. While preparation is already an important part of success in the Soulsborne series, the extra strain that Sinh imparts changes the minor benefits of keeping a collection of consumable items or a robust build into a necessity.

Sinh, the Slumbering Dragon Gives as Good as He Gets

The Decay Hiding Under Sinh's Surface

The mechanic that makes Sinh unique is the fact that his scales are corrosive, and will quickly drain the durability from any weapons that strike him. In most of FromSoftware's catalog, this would be a minor annoyance, possibly requiring the player to repair their weapons between attempts. However, even Dark Souls 2 's best weapons have the least durability of any equipment throughout the Soulsborne series, with weapons readily breaking from one boss encounter to the next without Sinh's corrosive scales.

As a result, most weapons brought into the fight against Sinh won't last long enough against the dragon's corrosive scales to kill the boss without either dropping in damage output or breaking outright. This doubles the war of attrition between the player and Sinh, where the player isn't only managing their healing items against the boss' health bar, but also the durability of their weapons. For players wandering into this encounter unprepared, Sinh can then become one of the toughest fights in the Dark Souls series because of this steady loss of damage output.

Preparing for Sinh's Corrosive Backlash

One way to prepare for Sinh's corrosive scales is to bring a hefty amount of repair powders, a rather pricey consumable item that can be purchased from Chancellor Wellager in Drangleic Castle. Other than the costly repair powders, there is also the Repair sorcery that replenishes its casting limits from one encounter to the next. Of course, for players diving into the powerful magic builds of Dark Souls 2 , casting spells from a distance might be a better course of action than relying on the Repair sorcery.

Another possibility for making it through the Sinh encounter is to utilize a more flexible build, one that doesn't hinge on a single weapon at a time. This would then give the player multiple weapons to burn through before reaching the end of the fight, bypassing the need to pull back in the middle of the fight and repair. Considering how long the repair animation can take, the powder can make any of Dark Souls 2 's weapons impractical against Sinh if players need to duck away and heal their gear along with themselves.

Sinh Makes the Most out of Durability in Dark Souls 2

Considering that weapon durability has been almost completely phased out by the time of Elden Ring 's release, the brittle weapons of Dark Souls 2 are a quickly divisive design decision for what is already a controversial entry in the Soulsborne series. However, by building in a near certainty for weapons to break against Sinh, it forces the mechanic to become a critical part of combat in a way that it rarely does anywhere else. The result is a unique way to highlight weapon durability, taking the mechanic from a minor annoyance to an actual concern that dictates how players prepare.

item.title: Alan Wake 2: All Night Springs Stash Locations
item.description:
With the launch of the Night Springs Expansion in Alan Wake 2, players are trying the different episodes to witness unique and bizarre what-if scenarios. These scenarios are not related to the main story of the game. There are three episodes, each with a different playable character from the world of Alan Wake and Remedy itself.

In Episode 2: North Star, players take control of Jesse Faden from Federal Bureau of Control, who is referred to as The Sibling. Inside the dark and eerie Coffee World, players can come across Stashes that appear to be locked, but can be opened by solving a simple puzzle. Here's where to find them all, and how to open them.

Where To Find All The Stashes

There are six Stashes in Night Springs, similar to the ones in the base game. These stashes are not far from the light checkpoint where Sheriff Tim Breaker is sitting. The table below shows the locations of all the stashes.

Stash Number

Image

Location

1

From the light checkpoint, turn back and head towards the main path. On the right, there should be a tree with the stash right next to it.

2

Head down the main path and go right past the Welcome Center. You will come to a locked ride. On the left of this is the second stash.

3

Go left of the Welcome Center and hug the right wall. You will soon come to a shack with a few pieces of equipment, as well as the third stash.

4

Head to the Testing Room and turn right. There should be another stash located at the end of the path near a cup.

5

Head left of the previous stash towards the Ferris wheel. The fifth stash should be on the left side next to the porta potty.

6

Head to the Coffee Warehouse, where the last stash should be located on the left behind the car.

How To Solve The Stashes & What's Inside

The hard part is finding the stashes inside Coffee World. Once you find one, you can interact with it by pressing the button prompt. You will see a random sequence displayed on your screen. By performing the same sequence again perfectly, you will open the stash. As you collect more stashes, the sequence gets harder, but you can always retry or check the sequence again if you find yourself stuck.

Once a stash is opened, you will find Handgun ammo for your weapon, a Battery Pack, and a Trauma Pad that you can stock up on and use while fighting the group of Takens.

item.title: Xbox Game Pass Confirms Another Day One Game for July 18
item.description:
Highlights

  • Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn is set to launch as a day-one Xbox Game Pass game on July 18, 2024.
  • The game combines gunplay, melee combat, and magic abilities in a fantasy world where players are tasked with taking down gods.
  • Xbox Game Pass continues a strong year comprised of both quality and variety.

Microsoft and A44 Games have revealed the release date for Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn , an upcoming Soulslike that's set to launch as a day-one Xbox Game Pass game on July 18. So far, 2024 has been a pretty strong year for Microsoft's gaming subscription service in terms of both quality and variety. Fortunately, with major additions like Flintlock releasing in the near future, it looks like the next few months will continue to maintain the momentum that Xbox Game Pass has built up lately.

Created by indie developer A44 Games and published by Kepler Interactive, Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn was announced as a day-one Game Pass release in early 2022, alongside a reveal trailer for the title. In the last few years, the developers have shared loads of information on Flintlock in deep-dive gameplay videos and interviews, from the game's inspirations and story details to its unlockable abilities and mission designs. The one thing A44 Games didn't provide any info on, however, was a proper release date for the title. Although Flintlock was initially scheduled to launch the same year it was announced in 2022, the game was hit with delay after delay until, eventually, the developers settled on a release date in 2024. Luckily, it's surprisingly not too far away.

During the 2024 Xbox Games Showcase, Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn received a brief new trailer that gave players a glimpse of the difficult-looking Soulslike RPG's combat elements, in addition to providing a release date of July 18, 2024 for the game. An official Xbox Wire blog post had some more information to share about the upcoming title, as it revealed that pre-orders for Flintlock are currently available on all platforms at the price of $39.99, a considerably lower cost than most brand-new AAA releases. Gamers who are willing to spend a bit more money can also purchase a deluxe edition of Flintlock that "offers alternative outfits and weapon customization" for only $5 more.

Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn is One of the Biggest Day-One Additions to Game Pass in June 2024

As stated in the description provided by Microsoft, Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn takes place in the setting of Kian, an endangered fantasy world where monstrous gods run rampant and unleash armies of dead upon humanity. Gamers play as "a Flintlock weapons expert" named Nor Vanek who's on a quest to kill gods and other enemies in order to take back her world. The self-proclaimed "Souls-lite" combines gunplay, melee combat, and magic abilities to create a diverse combat system that centers around unleashing "devastating combos," akin to action games like God of War .

Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn isn't the only big day-one addition to Game Pass next month, as the new Capcom game Kunitsu-Gami: Path of the Goddess is coming to Microsoft's subscription service on July 19, 2024. Funnily enough, that's only a day after the release of A44 Games' upcoming Soulslike. Those who aren't interested in either of these two titles, however, have plenty of other Xbox Game Pass games to look forward to, as the 2024 Xbox Games Showcase just indicated.

item.title: Everholm - Official Trailer
item.description: Everholm is a minimalist isekai RPG about a girl exploring a magical world, as sown in the reveal trailer at PC Gaming show 2024.
